alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:41PM CST until February 01 at 4:21PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton. .Lowland flooding has developed along the Wabash from a combination of previous precipitation, snowmelt and additional rainfall on partially frozen ground. Minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 01... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Terre Haute. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to Thursday, February 01. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, Water begins to rise in the Izaak Walton Lake. Sheet flowing water begins in the wetland project between U.S. 40 and I-70, and during a prolonged flood event project fills about 75 percent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Thursday /12:30 PM CST Thursday/ the stage was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 19.4 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, February 01. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 545 AM EST /445 AM CST/.
